messages.original: 3 in total. Launch maneuvers were carried out.
3 in total. Flying one after another.

2 Kinzhals to Shepetivka, Khmelnytskyi Oblast.
1 Kinzhal to Hostomel, Kyiv Oblast.
2 Kinzhals to Shepetivka, Khmelnytskyi Oblast. 1 Kinzhal to Hostomel, Kyiv Oblast.
2 Kinzhals are flying further to Burshtyn, Ivano-Frankivsk Oblast.

The remaining 2 Tu-95MS carried out launch maneuvers from Arkhangelsk Oblast. 
If these are real, they should enter Ukrainian airspace in the next 70-100 minutes.
The remaining 2 Tu-95MS carried out launch maneuvers from Arkhangelsk Oblast.   If these are real, they should enter Ukrainian airspace in the next 70-100 minutes.

These launches were likely simulated, meaning that the missile attack (or at least most of it) is now over. More than 30 missiles of various types were used. I will publish a full report + the consequences later on. 
If you wish to support my work, you can do so here: 
https://buymeacoffee.com/amk_mapping
. 
Thank you for following along.

Last night and this morning, another large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine.
Missiles launched:
~14 Kh-101 cruise missiles launched from 7 Tu-95MS strategic bombers at their launch lines in southern Nizhny Novgorod Oblast.
~6 Kh-101 cruise missiles launched from 3 Tu-95MS strategic bombers at their launch lines in Kalachyovksy District, Volgograd Oblast.
~10 Kh-101 cruise missiles launched from 2 Tu-160M strategic bombers at their launch lines in southern Nizhny Novgorod Oblast.
~4 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 4 MiG-31K fighters at their launch lines in the vicinity of Lipetsk City, Lipetsk Oblast.
-----------------------
Ukrainian air defence work:
As of the time of writing, Ukrainian air defence is confirmed to have intercepted at least 9 Kh-101 cruise missiles.
-----------------------
The main targets for this strike were Ukrainian energy infrastructure. The following was targeted:
"Zhytomyr" 330 kV electrical substation, Zhytomyr Oblast (50.29100, 28.69980) by ~5 Kh-101s.
"Shepetivka" 330 kV electrical substation, Khmelnytskyi Oblast (50.14639, 27.0579) by ~9 Kh-101s and ~4 Kinzhals.
Unknown target in southern Khmelnytskyi Oblast by ~5 Kh-101s
Unknown target near the Ivano-Frankivsk - Ternopil border by ~5 Kh-101s
-----------------------
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched may be slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected is often lower than actual launches.

Smoke was seen rising over Zhytomyr city following a series of Russian Kh-101 cruise missile strikes this morning. 
The strikes targeted the city's 330 kV electrical substation, resulting in widespread power outages.

This morning, a Russian Geran-2 drone struck the roof of an apartment building in Kyiv.
Judging by the speed of the drone, the altitude change, and how it was tilting towards the end of its flight, it was likely under the influence of Ukrainian electronic warfare.
At least four civilians were injured.

This morning, a Russian Geran-2 drone struck the roof of an apartment building in Kyiv.
Judging by the speed of the drone, the altitude change, and how it was tilting towards the end of its flight, it was likely under the influence of Ukrainian electronic warfare.
At least four civilians were injured.

Overnight, dozens of Russian Geran-2 drones attacked the city of Rivne. 
The main target was the city's 330 kV electrical substation, where a large fire subsequently broke out. Widespread power outages are reported.

Key To Russian Advance: Strategic Significance Of Zakotne In Slaviansk Sector For Ukraine
In the Slaviansk sector, Russian units are carrying out an offensive in the Sviato-Pokrovske area, advancing from the north and south. In the vicinity of Konstantynivka, Russian assault groups are tightening their grip on the approaches to the city by advancing into the built-up area from Predtechyne. 
Meanwhile, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n stated that Hungarian money should not go to Ukrainian oligarchs.

Russian-Ukrainian Exchange Of Strikes: Odesa Ports Under Fire Again, 'Flamingo' Maker Hosts Blindfolded Journalists
As in previous days, the hottest spot in Ukraine during this 24-hour period was once again the Odesa region, where strikes have now been carried out for the fifth consecutive day, deliberately targeting and damaging energy and port infrastructure.
Against the backdrop of ongoing shelling, the Ukrainian media space continues to make active attempts to restore the reputation of Fire Point, a company known for producing the long-range FP-1 and FP-2 drones as well as the experimental "Flamingo" cruise missile. The company found itself at the center of a corruption scandal involving businessman Mindich. As part of a PR campaign, groups of foreign and local journalists have been taken to the enterprise‚Äîwhose location is classified‚Äîblindfolded, according to the journalists themselves.
üëâ

Fragile Syria: Deadly Ethnic-Sectarian Clashes In Aleppo And Suwayda Show Country Is Not Healing
Two rounds of clashes broke out in Syria late on December 22, one caused by ethnic tensions in the northern governorate of Aleppo and another fueled by sectarianism in the southern governorate of Suwayda, in a clear example of how the country, more than a year after the fall of the regime of former President Bashar al-Assad, is becoming more insatiable and fragmented.

Netanyahu Says Turkey Should ‚ÄòForget‚Äô About Its Empire, Promises Iran ‚ÄòSevere' Attack
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued warnings to both Turkey and Iran from Jerusalem on December 22, following a meeting with Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis and Cypriot President Nikos Christodoulides, in a move that highlights Israel‚Äôs regional ambition in the wake of the war in the Gaza Strip.
In a direct hint to Turkey and its neo-Ottoman ambitions, Netanyahu said that ‚Äúthose who fantasize they can reestablish their empires and their dominion over our lands‚Äù should ‚Äúforget it.‚Äù
Of course, Netanyahu didn‚Äôt miss the chance to send a new threat from Jerusalem to Iran, especially after the recent escalation.
